newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Acesita shrs off 59.4 pct so far in yr.
newsitem.headline: Acesita shrs off 59.4 pct so far in yr.

text.p: Preferred shares of Brazilian specialty steelmaker Acesita have tumbled 59.4 percent so far this year and analysts attribute the drop partly to the firm's strategy to expand and diversify, a local newspaper said.
Gazeta Mercantil said the drop in Acesita shares between January 1 and September 2 contrasts with a 11.6 percent rise for the steel sector as a whole in the same period.

Gazeta said analysts feel Acesita President Wilson Brumer erred in deciding earlier this year to make an 850 million real offer to buy stakes in three other steel mills -- Usiminas, Cosipa and Cia Siderurgica de Tubarao (CST).
Gazeta said Acesita preferred, which traded at 5.65 reais per 1,000 shares last December, fell 24 percent to 4.28 reais in late April, when the firm announced the offer.
Acesita ended up buying only a stake in CST for 504 million reais.
Brumer, a former top executive at state mining giant Cia restructuring Vale's debt, became president of Acesita in December 1992.
Acesita posted a first-half loss of 29.4 million reais.
